        public void fillVision(com.csc2013.PlayerVision vision)

      • fillSurrounding

        private void fillSurrounding(com.csc2013.MapBox box,
                   int x,
                   int y)
        Fills in information of all the squares surrounding a MapBox
        Parameters:
        box - The MapBox to extract the info from. Must be either Open or a Key.
        x - X coordinate of the square
        y - Y coordinate of the square

      • saveSpace

        private Space saveSpace(int x,
              int y,
              com.csc2013.DungeonMaze.BoxType type)
        If a space already exists, verify that it is correct. If it doesn't, add it and link it to surrounding nodes.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the Space
        y - Y coordinate of the Space
        type - The type of space it is
        Returns:
        The Space which either already existed in the map or which we added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If the space already exists and the previous type contrasts with the new one

      • applyMove

        Let's the map know that we moved in a direction
        Parameters:
        dir - The DungeonMaze.Direction we moved in

      • getUnblockedSpaces

        public java.util.List<Space> getUnblockedSpaces()
        Collects a List of all the Spaces in our map which are not blocked. This function includes doors.
        Returns:
        The list

      • getMap

        public java.util.HashMap<java.awt.Point,Space> getMap()
        Gets the entire map. The key is the Point the Space is located on relative to (0,0) being the initial position. North, South, East, and West are +y,-y,+x,-x respectively. Please do not edit the map.
        Returns:
        The map.

      • getLocation

        public java.awt.Point getLocation()
        Our player's current location relative to (0,0) being their initial position.
        Returns:
        Their location
